Object B (a circular food item that looks like a grapefruit dessert) casts shadow B
Object C (a roll of medical bandage with a red cross) casts shadow C
Object D (a ring or bracelet) casts shadow D

In the first image, all shadows are clearly visible and appear to be cast to the left and slightly forward from their respective objects, indicating the light source is positioned to the right and slightly behind the viewer's perspective.

When the light source moves to the back right (as shown in the second image): All shadows have shifted position. They now appear more directly to the left of their objects rather than to the left and forward.
The shadows appear to have become slightly longer, suggesting the light source is now at a lower angle relative to the objects.
The shadows maintain similar sharpness, suggesting the light source remains a similar distance away, just at a different angle.
